newsitem.title: GERMANY: German call money rates ease to 3.05/10 pct.
newsitem.headline: German call money rates ease to 3.05/10 pct.

text.p: German call money rates eased on Monday to 3.05/3.10 percent from Friday's highs of 4.25/50 percent, but demand remained strong after the market struggled to meet end-of-month reserve requirements before the weekend.

High levels of cash in circulation at the weekend and the restructuring process after the end-of-month scramble prevented rates from making a faster return toward the securities repurchase rate level of three percent, dealers said.
"Call money is in demand. The rates were 3.05/3.10 at the start but in the meantime I would put them at 3.07 to 3.10 percent," said one dealer.
Rates were expected to reapproach the three percent level in the near future, dealers said.
Bank deposits with the central bank fell to 39.9 billion marks on Friday from 43.2 billion marks and the monthly average was unchanged on Saturday at 29.6 billion marks.
Borrowings at the Lombard window on Friday were 800 million marks, down from 4.4 billion marks.
